oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Better possibilities in agriculture due to climate change - but will there be farmers left in Finnish Lapland in 2039?
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hannukkala, Antti
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Environmental aspects
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
At the moment the agriculture in Finnish Lapland is based on animal production, especially on ruminants, dairy cows, beef cattle and sheep.
According to best guess climate change scenarios the growing season will be about two weeks longer, 1-2 C warmer and the winers two three weeks shorter by 2039 than it is today.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hannukkala, Antti (2010) Better possibilities in agriculture due to climate change - but will there be farmers left in Finnish Lapland in 2039? In: Circumpolar agricultural and land use resources - prospects and perspectives for circumpolar productions and industries : abstract booklet, Bioforsk, pp. 14-15.
